common_issues.title: PiecesOS Desktop App Launch Failures
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS Desktop App failing to launch, often after updates, on macOS and Windows. Issues include Apple Silicon compatibility, stricter hardware requirements, and core dependency loading problems. Solutions involve reinstalling correct versions, waiting for data migration, troubleshooting conflicting software, and updating to the latest patch release (11.1.1).

related_issues.title: Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
related_issues.text:
Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I cannot install pieces Desktop App, or it fails to run.  I originally reported this by email on 9 Jan 2025, and the response email referred to an existing issue on github #546.  However this issue now seems closed, hence I am raising it here as a new bug.
 
I have recently installed pieces OS on my Mac with a package dmg.  The pieces OS appears to install, and I see the icon in the top bar.  Pieces appears to connect to the cloud successfully, and I can install plugins for Intellij, VSCode and Obsidian.  These are visible within the pieces OS icon at the top.  
 
Pieces appears to work from IDE plugins.   However I cannot launch the Desktop App, and ‘launch pieces for developers’ from the top Pieces menu fails silently.

I have recently upgraded Pieces OS, now on 11.1.1
 
Info:
 
Mac OS: Sequoia 15.2
Chip: Apple M1 Pro
 
Pieces OS: 11.1.1 (was installed as 11.0.3(
Pieces desktop app – won’t install
Pieces OS seems to be running in ‘activity monitor’
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Issue:** Unable to launch PiecesOS on Apple Silicon Mac
**Reported by:** @PASimmons
**Date:** February 10, 2025

**Key points:**

* User reports being unable to launch PiecesOS despite having an M1 chip Mac.
* The issue was identified as incorrect installation of the software for the user's specific hardware (Apple Silicon vs Intel).

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark from Pieces support suggested:
    * Killing the `pieces_qdrant_server` process in Activity Monitor.
    * Providing support logs from `/Users/{USERNAME}/Library/com.pieces.os/production/Support`.
    * Uninstalling and reinstalling Pieces for Developers and PiecesOS using the Apple Silicon download link from the Pieces website.

**Outcome:**

The issue was resolved by the user following the steps suggested by Mark. He confirmed that Pieces for Developers is now running fine.

**Current Status:**

The issue is closed. 

**Additional notes:**

* There is an ongoing announcement about this issue in #615.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch.
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7a6a7957-5aa1-4d53-b492-cf4470aa5edc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points:**

* DevWizard24 reported an issue with Pieces not launching.
* The issue appears to be related to stricter hardware requirements in version 11.1.1.
* Support team requested logs for troubleshooting.
* A patch release is planned within 24-48 hours to resolve the issue.

**Problems identified:**

* Pieces app not launching for some users.
* Stricter hardware requirements in version 11.1.1 causing incompatibility for some users.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Support team requested logs for diagnosis.
* A patch release is planned for the next 24-48 hours to address the hardware compatibility issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Patch release is expected soon to resolve the issue. 
* The team is actively working on a fix and appreciates user patience.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue is related to another reported issue (#625).
* Support team is actively communicating with users and providing updates.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation (#613) - PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up (cannot run)

**Key Points:**

* **Issue:** PiecesOS takes a long time to boot up and sometimes gets stuck at the `ensure core dependencies` stage.
* **Affected Platforms:** Windows, macOS Monterey
* **Potential Causes:**
    * Major migration of data from old stack to new stack (11.1.0)
    * Issues with the `appInstaller` build
    * Conflicting software (e.g., OneDrive)
* **Solutions:**
    * Wait for the migration to complete (give it a few minutes)
    * Restart PiecesOS Desktop application
    * Contact support for further assistance
    * Check for conflicting software and remove if necessary
    * Update to version 11.1.1

**Current Status:**

* Most issues have been resolved with the release of version 11.1.1.
* Some users may still experience issues with conflicting software (e.g., OneDrive).
* Further updates are expected to address remaining issues.

**Additional Notes:**

* This issue was originally reported for Windows but also affects users on macOS Monterey.
* The conversation includes troubleshooting steps and solutions specific to each platform.
* Users are encouraged to report any unresolved issues to the PiecesOS support team.

**Outcome:**

* Issue largely resolved with version 11.1.1.
* Ongoing efforts to address remaining issues and improve application stability.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS fails to launch after update
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS failing to launch after updating to version 11.1.1. The issue seems to stem from stricter hardware requirements, particularly impacting systems without AVX2 instruction set support. The Pieces team is aware of the problem and is actively working on a patch. As a temporary workaround, users can try providing their system specs to the support team.

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation (Feb 10-13, 2025)

**Problem:** Users are experiencing issues booting up the application, particularly those with processors that don't support AVX2 instruction sets.

**Key points:**

* User @GetReal444 reported the issue and provided logs showing the error message related to AVX2 support.
* This issue was related to previous reported issues (#620, #624, #625).
* The Pieces team confirmed that the issue affects more users than initially expected and was related to a hardware requirement on their database service.

**Solutions:**

* The team is actively working on a solution and expects a patch to be released within 24-48 hours (as of Feb 11, 2025).
* As a temporary solution, users were encouraged to provide a screenshot of their machine's tech specs.

**Current status:**

* The issue is being actively addressed by the Pieces team.
* A patch is expected to be released by February 14, 2025.

**Outcome:**

* This conversation highlights the importance of user feedback and the Pieces team's responsiveness in addressing issues reported by users.
* Once the patch is released, users with AVX2-unsupported processors should be able to boot up the application without encountering the error.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* @gonzososa reported an issue where PiecesOS was unable to launch.
* @tsavo-at-pieces confirmed the issue and acknowledged active work to resolve it.
* @nathan-courtney-pieces requested additional information about the user's system.

**Problems identified:**

* The issue seems to be related to the new vector library having AVX2 compatibility issues on different systems.
* The user's system configuration, particularly the CPU, might be impacting the launch.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Tsavo mentioned a new release with a potential solution scheduled for the next day.
* The support team requested additional information about the user's system, which may help identify the issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is actively being worked on and a resolution might be available in the next release.
* The user was advised to wait for the upcoming release and potentially provide further system details.
* The conversation ended with no further updates.

## Additional notes:

* The conversation indicates a prompt response from the Pieces support team and their commitment to resolving the issue.
* The support team requests additional information and provides potential solutions to expedite the troubleshooting process.

## Disclaimer

This summary is based on the provided conversation and may not include all relevant information.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported various performance issues with the Pieces desktop app, including slow boot-up, freezing, and premature saving of edits. These issues were observed across different operating systems (macOS, Windows, Linux). Solutions included bug fixes, software updates, and configuration changes (e.g., disabling on-screen keyboard).

related_issues.title: Conversation titles save too eagerly while editing
related_issues.text:
Conversation titles save too eagerly while editing
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I click on the title of Conversation in the Desktop app, I can edit it as expected but it will update save the input before I'm done editing.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* @seantiz reported an issue with renaming conversations in the Pieces app on January 17, 2025.
* @mack-at-pieces confirmed the issue and stated the Pieces team would investigate.

**Proposed/Implemented Solutions:**

* Pieces team released a patch for the Copilot and desktop app (v3.3.5 and 3.3.6) on February 10, 2025, to address the renaming issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* @seantiz confirmed the patch successfully resolved the renaming issue on February 11, 2025.
* @mack-at-pieces encouraged @seantiz to report any new issues encountered.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation highlights the responsiveness and efficiency of the Pieces support team in addressing user-reported issues.
* The issue was resolved within a month of being reported.

related_issues.title: [Linux Mint] Pieces app goes unresponsive on opening and every 5sec. Can't use it at all in any way
related_issues.text:
[Linux Mint] Pieces app goes unresponsive on opening and every 5sec. Can't use it at all in any way
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces app goes unresponsive and freezes a lot when trying to do anything, like trying to type in copilot chat or navigating through the menus. Can't use pieces app at all! Tried reinstalling it, but it made no difference. Desktop app version is 3.3.6

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e75595c0-31c8-4560-b08b-9ad3de8af6ab
## GitHub Issue Summary: Pieces App Freezing on Linux Mint

**Key Points:**

* User @94tejas reported that the Pieces app was freezing on Linux Mint.
* The issue was linked to the on-screen keyboard in accessibility settings.
* Freezing issue was potentially due to a known Flutter bug (#153560).

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Disable the on-screen keyboard in accessibility settings.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Workaround solved the freezing issue for the user (@94tejas).
* The reported Flutter bug needs fixing.
* Maintainer will monitor the Flutter releases for a permanent patch.
* Issue closed until a long-term solution is implemented.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS launch failure due to hardware incompatibility
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported Pieces OS failing to launch after updating to version 11.1.1. The issue stems from stricter hardware requirements, particularly processors lacking AVX2 support. The Pieces team acknowledged the issue and is working on a patch. As a temporary solution, users can share their system specs for potential workarounds.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I'm not able to download any of the models for ollama.
[log-02022025.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18631166/log-02022025.txt)

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8e93857a-de7e-4e62-b3d0-c6a68b48631e
## Issue Summary: Ollama Installation Failure in Pieces

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@surya-sengupta) reported Ollama installation failure in Pieces.
* The issue started after one day of functionality and persisted after a clean reinstall.
* The user provided logs for troubleshooting.

**Problems Identified:**

* Ollama installation failure after an initial successful installation.
* The issue persisted after a clean reinstall.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The support team suggested updating to Pieces OS version 11.1.0 for stability upgrades.
* The user updated to the suggested version, but the issue remained.
* The support team requested additional logs for further investigation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved with further investigation pending.

**Additional Information:**

* The user also provided links to related issues and helpful resources.

**Note:** 

This summary is based on the conversation provided and may not reflect all aspects of the issue.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS fails to launch
common_issues.description: Users are reporting that the PiecesOS desktop application is failing to launch on their Windows machines. This issue appears to be related to stricter hardware requirements in recent versions, particularly for processors that do not support AVX2 instruction sets. The Pieces team is aware of the issue and is actively working on a patch to address it. In the meantime, users are encouraged to check for updates and ensure their hardware meets the minimum requirements.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

* @WhyQwerty23811 reported an issue with accessing Pieces.

**Problems Identified:**

* @WhyQwerty23811 seems to be experiencing issues accessing PiecesOS or the desktop version.
* It's unclear if the issue is related to Pieces being hosted over 39300 or not being hosted on 1000 and 3000.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces clarified that Pieces is not hosted on 1000 and 3000, but over 39300.
* They offered assistance to @WhyQwerty23811 if they are still experiencing difficulties accessing PiecesOS or the desktop.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The current status of the issue is unclear as @WhyQwerty23811 did not respond to @mark-at-pieces.

**Additional Notes:**

* The provided conversation only captures a small portion of the overall discussion. 
* More context may be needed to fully understand the issue and its potential solutions.
* The summary focuses on the most prominent details, but further analysis could reveal more nuanced information.

* Support team is actively communicating with users and providing updates.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving launch failures:** The most frequent and active support tickets revolve around PiecesOS and Desktop App launch failures, particularly after the 11.1.1 update. Focus on resolving these issues urgently to reduce ticket influx.

**Address hardware incompatibility:** Investigate and patch the AVX2 instruction set incompatibility causing launch failures for users on older hardware. Consider providing clear system requirements documentation.

**Improve communication about known issues:**  The hardware incompatibility issue seems to have caught many users off guard. Proactively communicate known issues and workarounds, potentially through in-app notifications or a dedicated status page.

**Investigate and address performance issues:** Several tickets report performance issues like slow boot-up and freezing. Allocate resources to diagnose and address these issues to improve the user experience.

**Review PiecesOS update process:** The update to version 11.1.1 introduced significant issues. Review the update process to ensure smoother transitions and minimize breaking changes for users in the future.

**Gather more detailed system information:** Encourage users to provide detailed system specs when reporting issues to aid in faster diagnosis and resolution. Consider automating this process through log collection or system profiling tools.

**Consider a dedicated bug bounty program:** Given the recurrence of bugs like the conversation title saving issue, explore implementing a bug bounty program to incentivize users to report bugs and security vulnerabilities.
